ref: 4696 *carpa ʻ flat ʼ. 2. carpaṭa -- ʻ lying flat to the head (of ears) ʼ VarBr̥S., m. ʻ palm of hand, thin biscuit of flour ʼ lex., carpaṭī -- f. ʻ flat cake ʼ lex. 3. *carpaṭṭa -- . [Cf. Psht. ċapaq, Orm. čapâg ʻ flat hand ʼ IIFL i 391 and carvan -- m. ʻ slap with open palm ʼ lex.: see cipiṭá -- , capēṭa -- , *capp -- ]
S. capu m. ʻ lip ʼ, capo m. ʻ palm of hand, hand -- breadth, blade of oar ʼ;
L. cappā ʻ having horns pointing outwards ʼ;
P. cappā m. ʻ breadth of 4 fingers ʼ;
B. cāp ʻ solidified clod ʼ, cāpā ʻ cover ʼ;
M. ċāp m. ʻ lobe of ear ʼ.
